metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1800 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The crack gem 0.3.1 and earlier for Ruby does not properly restrict casts of string values, which might allow remote attackers to conduct object-injection attacks and execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial of service (memory and CPU consumption) by leveraging Action Pack support for (1) YAML type conversion or (2) Symbol type conversion, a similar vulnerability to CVE-2013-0156.

criterions.comment: ruby-crack: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
